content.question: The inclusion in the passage of Esi’s memory that she “would have married him in the summer...” best supports which claim about how the transatlantic slave trade affected West African societies?

choices.label: The ethnic warfare associated with the transatlantic slave trade politically destabilized many states located in the interior of West Africa.
Increased contacts with Europe led to the creation of new cultural traditions in West African coastal states that participated in the transatlantic slave trade.
Some West African societies experienced significant demographic and cultural disruption and loss of kin as a result of the transatlantic slave trade.
West African societies were generally less affected by the transatlantic slave trade than were societies in South and East Africa, such as Great Zimbabwe.

content.answer: Some West African societies experienced significant demographic and cultural disruption and loss of kin as a result of the transatlantic slave trade.

topic.text: 2.3: Capture and the Impact of the Slave Trade on West African Societies
